conbody.p: A time-series analysis is the analysis of data collected over a certain period. Thus it is a study of the coherence between two variables whose independent variable is the time. A time-series analysis can be used to predict future values ​​in the time series (forecasting).

A time series analysis always starts with displaying the time series in a chart. Always on the horizontal axis the time and on the vertical axis the variable to be tested. Mostly the chart gives you a first picture of the characteristics of the time series. Things to watch out for are:
Is there a trend? This means that the variable tends to increase (continuously rising) or decrease (continuously decreasing).
Is there seasonality? This means that a regularly recurring pattern of peaks and drops can be seen related to certain times such as seasons, quarters, months, weekdays, etc.
Are there outliers? These are values ​​that are far from the other values.
Is there a long term cycle? This is not related to seasonal factors.
Is there a constant variance of the variable over time or does it becomes larger or smaller?
Are there sudden changes in size or variance?

Based on the characteristics in the chart, you try to describe the course of the time series and to determine what components the time series exists and make a model. (For this latter you need some statistical knowledge). This is usually not easy because you can not see these parts (patterns) in the chart.
